CONFRONTING CHINA — DEFENSE INDUSTRIAL BASE FACES ‘UNPRECEDENTED RISKS’: President Donald Trump is scheduled to participate in a presentation of the Pentagon’s new defense industrial base report this afternoon in the Oval Office.

“Among the risk factors identified in the report are ‘aggressive’ Russian and Chinese industrial policies that have led to ‘surprisingly high foreign dependence’ on those competitors, sequestration, ‘the decline of critical markets and suppliers,’ unintentional blowback from the U.S. government’s own slow acquisition processes and the changing mix of skills in the American workforce.”

The president's trade and manufacturing adviser, Peter Navarro, explains the report’s findings and the administration’s plans for them in an op-ed in The New York Times.
